info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 3:41AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Nueces, south central Jim Wells and Kleberg Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 340 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Falfurrias Junior High School to 8 miles southwest of Sarita to near U S 77 Border Patrol Station to 11 miles south of Kenedy County Wind Farms. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingsville, Bishop, Riviera Beach, Riviera, Ricardo, Kingsville Naval Air Station, Malaquite Beach and Loyola Beach. This includes US Highway 77 between mile markers 682 and 708. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
